results.description: Combine competitor recent returns with competitor count to capture momentum spillovers. Applied SUGGESTION1 (used 2 datafields). SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (both coverage >0.6). SUGGESTION4 applied (rel_ret_comp has high user/alpha counts). Kept implementation short per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence set to 0.72 because competitor returns historically predict peer moves but subject to noise.

Mean-revert instrument when its customers' averaged returns have spiked. SUGGESTION1 used 1 datafield (focus on strongest signal). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 applied because rel_ret_cust coverage=0.4921 (<0.6): ts_backfill used. SUGGESTION4 partially applied (rel_ret_cust has lower userCount). Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.60 due to lower coverage.

Use competitors' HITS authority score times their averaged returns to predict instrument moves. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_com_rk_au, rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION2 not applied. SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage high). SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_com_rk_au has strong usage). Confidence 0.75 given network centrality often leads price impact.

results.idea: Customer network pagerank x customer returns
results.description: Blend customer PageRank with customer returns to detect demand-driven moves. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. SUGGESTION2 not applied. SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust (coverage<0.6) via ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30). SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank has decent userCount). Confidence 0.68.

Favor names where partner count is low but partner-averaged returns are rising. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (rel_num_part, rel_ret_part). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage rel_num_part=0.7837, rel_ret_part=0.7097). SUGGESTION4 applied (rel_num_part high userCount). Kept to 3 operators. Confidence 0.66.

Use competitor PageRank times competitor return volatility to measure idiosyncratic risk transmission. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_com_page_rank, rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION3 not needed. SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_com_page_rank high userCount). Confidence 0.63 because volatility signals are noisy.

Scale competitor-averaged returns by instrument market cap to capture sensitivity. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_revere_index_cap, rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage high). SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_revere_index_cap very high userCount). Confidence 0.71.

Signals when company focuses on few key sectors (high key_sector_total) and competitors' return spikes. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_revere_key_sector_total, rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage high). SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_revere_key_sector_total high userCount). Confidence 0.64.

Customers' hub rank times their momentum to detect demand cascades. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank, rel_ret_cust). SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust (coverage<0.6). SUGGESTION4 partly applied. Confidence 0.62.

Detect divergence between competitor count trend and competitor returns: when returns rise but competitor count falls expect stronger moves. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. SUGGESTION3 not needed. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.59.

High authority customers with rising returns predict instrument upside. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank, rel_ret_cust). SUGGESTION3 applied to rel_ret_cust via ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4 partially applied. Confidence 0.67.

Use ts_ir of competitor returns to find stable outperformers among peers. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_comp only. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage high). SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.70 due to IR stability.

When instrument has unusually low partner-count relative to history, expect reversion if partners' returns rebound. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (rel_num_part, rel_ret_part). SUGGESTION3 not needed. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.55
Cross-sectional rank PageRank times competitor momentum to overweight central firms with rising peer returns. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. SUGGESTION4 applied. No ts_backfill needed. Confidence 0.69.

Use changes in index value tied to the company (pv13_revere_index_value) combined with competitor returns to detect macro-driven moves. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. Coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4 applied to pv13_revere_index_value moderate userCount. Confidence 0.58.

Firms operating in many terminal sectors may have diversified resilience; combine term_sector_total with competitor volatility. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. Coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4 applied (pv13_revere_term_sector_total strong usage). Confidence 0.52.

Use regional concentration (pv13_revere_zipcode) with customer returns to capture local demand shocks. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. Applied ts_backfill to rel_ret_cust (coverage<0.6). SUGGESTION4 applied to zipcode. Confidence 0.50.

Parent sector code combined with competitors' returns to find leader-based spillovers. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields (pv13_revere_parent, rel_ret_comp). pv13_revere_parent coverage=0.6205 borderline; applied no backfill. SUGGESTION4 limited. Confidence 0.56.

Companies with similar products may transmit returns; use revere_comproduct_company with competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields; pv13_revere_comproduct_company coverage=0.4078 -> applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence 0.54.

When company competitor PageRank diverges from customer PageRank trends, expect repositioning. Used pv13_com_page_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank. No backfill needed. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.57.
Use rel_num_cust as a liquidity/demand proxy combined with competitor returns. Coverage rel_num_cust=0.5068 -> ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION4 used rel_num_cust high userCount. Confidence 0.61.
Simple zscore of competitor returns to capture momentum vs peers. Single field approach per SUGGESTION1. No backfill needed. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.66.
Lower kurtosis of customer returns suggests stable demand; use ts_kurtosis(rel_ret_cust) with backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied (rel_ret_cust low coverage). SUGGESTION4 limited. Confidence 0.49.
Aggregate partner counts and partner returns to measure influence. Used rel_num_part and rel_ret_part. No backfill needed. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.63.

High recent correlation between instrument and competitors precedes co-movements. Use ts_corr between instrument rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_value (proxy index). SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.60.

High competitor pagerank combined with low instrument market cap signals takeover of attention. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank and pv13_revere_index_cap. No backfill needed. Applied SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.62.
Difference between competitor authority and hub scores to detect structural shifts. Used pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank. Coverage high; SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.55.

Low primary_sector_focused_company_count with rising competitor returns suggests niche leadership. primary_sector_focused_company_count coverage low -> ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION4 limited. Confidence 0.53.
Market cap momentum of company itself indicates institutional flows; use ts_delta on pv13_revere_index_cap with competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. No backfill. Confidence 0.68.

High vec-like dispersion of customer PageRanks signals concentrated influential customers. Vector operators not available; instead use stddev over time. Used pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank with ts_std_dev. SUGGESTION2 not applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum scaled by terminal sectors
results.description: Companies with many terminal sectors may better absorb shocks; combine term_sector_total with rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.54.

Relative strength of parent sector index (pv13_revere_parent) vs instrument's competitors. Used group_mean of rel_ret_comp by parent. Parent field coverage borderline but used as group. KEEP_IN_MIND4 respected (used as group parameter). Confidence 0.59.
Acceleration of competitor PageRank (momentum of pagerank) may presage attention flows. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank only. SUGGESTION2 not applied. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Customers' hub influence x competitor returns
results.description: Multiply customer hub rank with competitor returns to detect asymmetric demand. rel_ret_cust backfilled due to low coverage. SUGGESTION4 applied to hub rank usage. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Competitor count relative to sector size
results.description: Normalize number of competitors by total companies in sector to detect overcrowding. Used rel_num_comp and pv13_revere_company_total. pv13_revere_company_total coverage low -> ts_backfill applied. Confidence 0.51.
Compute ts_ir of customer returns to find consistent customer-driven performers. rel_ret_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION4 limited. Confidence 0.58.
Weight partner returns by competitor PageRank to capture networked partner influence. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_part. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.65.
Focus on companies in terminal low-level sectors with rising competitor returns. Used pv13_revere_level (coverage 0.6205) and rel_ret_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.53.
Combine customer PageRank with partner counts to detect structural distributor effects. rel_num_part high usage; pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank medium. No backfill. Confidence 0.56.
Use ts_max_diff of competitor returns to identify large recent drawdowns that may revert. SUGGESTION1 used rel_ret_comp only. No backfill. Confidence 0.60.

Difference between customer authority and hub scores indicates structural change in customer base. Used pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.52.
Mean-revert competitor PageRank to catch attention decay. Single field approach. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.45 (pagerank slow-moving).

results.idea: Competitor returns scaled by sector terminals
results.description: Scale competitor returns by number of terminal sectors to detect focused risk. Used pv13_revere_term_sector_total and rel_ret_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.53.
Detect when partner returns momentum diverges from competitor returns, signaling idiosyncratic moves. Used rel_ret_part and rel_ret_comp. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.58.
Use ts_scale on competitor returns over long window to detect regime. Single-field approach. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.62.
Backfilled customer count trend as demand proxy. rel_num_cust backfilled per SUGGESTION3. Combined with sign of recent change. Confidence 0.54.
High competitor PageRank but low customer return volatility signals asymmetric risk. Applied ts_backfill for rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Revere index cap zscore mean reversion
results.description: Revert extreme changes in company market cap. Single-field ts_zscore on pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.61.
High competitor authority with low partner count may indicate vulnerability; used pv13_com_rk_au and rel_num_part. No backfill. Confidence 0.55.
Use ts_delay on backfilled customer returns to capture delayed demand effects. rel_ret_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.53.
High kurtosis in competitor returns signals tail risk; penalize when kurtosis high. Single field rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.50.
Multiply competitor PageRank by competitor return IR to prefer central stable performers. SUGGESTION1 used 2 fields. No backfill. Confidence 0.70.
Momentum in partner count indicates growing distribution; use ts_delta(rel_num_part,30). SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence 0.57.
Cross-sectional quantile of competitor returns to find relative outperformers. Used quantile(rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION1 single field approach. Confidence 0.64.
Ratio of customers' PageRank to number of customers (backfilled) to detect concentrated influence. rel_num_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION4 used PageRank. Confidence 0.55.
When competitor PageRank is rising but competitor returns fall, expect reversal. Used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.58.
Changes in terminal sector count combined with competitor returns to find structural shifts. Used pv13_revere_term_sector_total and rel_ret_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.50.
High pagerank competitors with rising return volatility may transmit risk. Used pv13_com_page_rank and ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp). Confidence 0.61.
Winsorize backfilled customer returns and zscore to reduce outliers. Applied ts_backfill to rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.56.
ts_arg_max on competitor returns identifies recent peaks; combine with sign to capture persistence. Single field. Confidence 0.47.
Use ts_ir on partner returns to find consistent partner-driven performance. Single field rel_ret_part. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Competitor returns scaled by company index value
results.description: Scale competitor returns by inverse of company index value to emphasize smaller indexed firms. Used pv13_revere_index_value and rel_ret_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Revert extreme customer PageRank to capture attention normalization. Single field pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank. Confidence 0.49.
Use ts_std_dev of competitor count to avoid unstable markets. Single field rel_num_comp. Confidence 0.46.
High competitor PageRank and rising partner counts may presage distribution expansion. Used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_num_part. No backfill. Confidence 0.57.
Use ts_sum on backfilled customer returns to capture cumulative demand. rel_ret_cust backfilled per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.55.

ts_corr between rel_ret_comp and its lag to measure momentum persistence. Single field via ts_corr with ts_delay proxy using same field; implemented with ts_corr(rel_ret_comp, ts_delay(rel_ret_comp,1)). SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence 0.62.
Cross-sectional quantile of market cap to target small-cap sensitivity to peer moves. Single field pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.63.
Average HITS authority and hub scores of competitors to capture centrality. Used pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank. No backfill. Confidence 0.60.
When customer returns IR rises, instrument may benefit; compute ts_ir on backfilled rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Competitor pagerank divided by competitor count
results.description: Average attention per competitor as pagerank divided by competitor count. Used pv13_com_page_rank and rel_num_comp. No backfill. Confidence 0.58.
Quantile score of partner count to identify distribution outliers. Single field rel_num_part. Confidence 0.54.
Sign of short-term competitor returns to capture directionality. Single field. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Customers' PageRank scaled by company cap
results.description: High customer influence relative to company size indicates strong demand; used pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank and pv13_revere_index_cap. No backfill. Confidence 0.65.
Bucket competitor returns into deciles to trade extremes. Single field rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.60.
Multiply partner returns IR by competitor pagerank to capture influential partner effects. Used rel_ret_part and pv13_com_page_rank. No backfill. Confidence 0.62.
Rank backfilled customer returns over recent window to capture unusual demand. rel_ret_cust backfilled. Confidence 0.56.
Product of short-term competitor returns to detect multiplicative shocks. Single field rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.46.
Normalize competitor returns by number of companies in parent sector (backfilled). pv13_revere_company_total backfilled. Confidence 0.50.
High competitor pagerank in firms with many terminal sectors indicates focused influence; used pv13_com_page_rank and pv13_revere_term_sector_total. No backfill. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Competitor returns rolling zscore scaled by customers
results.description: Scale competitor zscore by customer count (backfilled) to emphasize demand-driven moves. rel_num_cust backfilled. SUGGESTION4 partially applied. Confidence 0.60.
Penalize partners with high volatility using ts_std_dev on rel_ret_part. Single field. Confidence 0.51.
Cross-sectional zscore of competitor PageRank to find relatively central firms. Single field pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.59.
Lagged IR of backfilled customer returns to pick delayed stable demand. rel_ret_cust backfilled. Confidence 0.55.
Winsorize competitor returns then zscore to avoid tail-driven false signals. Single field. Confidence 0.58.
Cross-sectional rank (quantile) of competitor PageRank momentum to highlight rising attention. Use ts_delta then quantile. Confidence 0.53.
Normalize partner count by company market cap to find distribution leverage. Used rel_num_part and pv13_revere_index_cap. No backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Use ts_std_dev of rel_ret_comp to downweight noisy signals. Single field. Confidence 0.58.
Detect spikes in customer PageRank by comparing current to recent mean; backfill returns when used. SUGGESTION3 not needed for pagerank. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Competitor returns group mean by product
results.description: Average competitor returns across same product group (pv13_revere_comproduct_company) to capture product-specific trends. pv13_revere_comproduct_company backfilled due to low coverage. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used group param. Confidence 0.62.
Multiply competitor PageRank by backfilled customers' IR to emphasize influential stable customer flows. rel_ret_cust backfilled. Confidence 0.66.
Reverse short-term competitor returns zscore to capture mean reversion. Single field. Confidence 0.47.
Quantile of partner returns to identify relative outperformers among partners. Single field rel_ret_part. Confidence 0.52.
High competitor PageRank with growing customer counts indicates demand concentration; backfill rel_num_cust. Confidence 0.58.
Zscore of pv13_revere_index_value to detect macro index moves tied to company. Single field. Confidence 0.51.
Spread between customer PageRank and partner count (backfilled) to find mismatches. rel_num_part high coverage no backfill needed. Confidence 0.53.
Multiply competitor authority by competitor IR to find central stable competitors. Used pv13_com_rk_au and rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.68.
